pr_title: VideoStreaming does not start during HMI Level "LIMITED"

timeline.message: Added check in VideoStreamManager to allow video streaming to start in HMI_LIMITED
Added checks to make video streaming to be started in hmiLevel LIMITED

timeline.bodyText: The error message is not accurate anymore cause video can stream in limited
timeline.author: bilal-alsharifi

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't we also check alow calling checkState() method on line 154 when level = LIMTED?
timeline.author: bilal-alsharifi
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -205,7 +205,7 @@ private synchronized void checkState(){
 		if(this.getState() == SETTING_UP

timeline.bodyText: Do isStreaming() and is isPaused() need to be updated as well? Please double-check how iOS handle that. Also, all usages for HMILevel in this class should be revisited to make sure they make sense for streaming video in LIMITED.
timeline.author: bilal-alsharifi
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -205,7 +205,7 @@ private synchronized void checkState(){
 		if(this.getState() == SETTING_UP
 				&& isTransportAvailable
 				&& hmiLevel != null
-				&& hmiLevel.equals(HMILevel.HMI_FULL)

timeline.message:
In VideoStreamManager, Added two list to hold hmi Levels

In VideoStreamManager, Added two list:
streamableLevels to hold hmi Levels that allow videoStreaming
nonStreamableLevels to hold hmi levels that do not allow streaming
Changed logic in class to use new list to check hmi states

timeline.author: bilal-alsharifi

timeline.message: Removed nonStreamableLevels list form videoStreamManager and changed it usage to !streamableLevels.contains
